document.docAuthor: Wang, Menglin, Zhang, Yalin & Bourgoin, Thierry
document.docTitle: Sarimissus maculifrons Wang & Zhang & Bourgoin 2019, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: On the tribe Sarimini with two new genera from south of China (Hemiptera, Fulgoromorpha, Issidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: On the tribe Sarimini with two new genera from south of China (Hemiptera, Fulgoromorpha, Issidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. This new species appears similar to
Eusarima contorta Yang, 1994
, but differs by: 1) Frons with a pair of curved eyelike markings on the disc ( Fig. 4 ), but the latter species without these eyelike markings ( Chan & Yang,1994 , fig. 45B); 2) Capitulum of gonostylus thick and short, with tip obtuse ( Fig. 9 ), but long and slender, with tip acute in
E. contorta
( Chan & Yang, 1994 , fig. 45E); 3) Aedeagus with a pair of short hook-like processes ( Fig. 10 ), but the latter species with a pair of extremely long processes ( Chan & Yang, 1994 , fig. 45H).
Etymology. This species name is a combination of Latin words “ macula ” and “ frons ”, referring to the light yellowish M-shaped markings on the frons.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Holotype : ♂ , China , Hainan Province , Jianfengling , Chahekou , N 18º 44.727′ , E 108º 59.632′ ,
235 m
,
17 viii 2010
, coll. Guo Zheng ( IZCAS ).
